overview_summary: Land ownership around the Rochelle project site is split between a solar development LLC backed by a national renewable energy investor and several private landholding entities (family trust, bank trustee, land trust, and family partnership). The developer (Rochelle Solar LLC) is an outside party pushing for a solar farm, whereas the other owners represent long-time local farmland interests who generally value agricultural use. These local landowners tend to keep a low profile publicly, but they collectively hold substantial acreage and could influence community sentiment against new development perceived to threaten farmland.

neighbors.name: Rochelle Solar Llc
neighbors.claims: Rochelle Solar LLC is a Delaware-registered LLC listed among the project subsidiaries of Greenbacker Renewable Energy Company LLC, a national renewable infrastructure fund [SEC Filing (Greenbacker Subsidiaries)](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1563922/000156392224000001/grec-20231231xex211.htm) [Greenbacker Press Release (Mar 1, 2022)](https://www.greenbackercapital.com/2022/03/greenbacker-acquires-solar-and-storage-portfolios-across-illinois-maine-and-new-york/). In 2025, it sought a special-use permit to build a 4.99 MW solar farm on about 30 acres of farmland near Rochelle, but the Ogle County Board unanimously denied the proposal as inconsistent with the county’s land-use plan for agriculture [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/). New Leaf Energy – the project developer associated with Rochelle Solar – touted the site’s lower-quality soil and promised community benefits like pollinator plantings and screening, yet local residents remained opposed, citing concerns about glare, noise, and property values [WIFR News (Sept 26, 2025)](https://www.wifr.com/2025/09/26/proposed-ogle-county-solar-farm-sparks-debate/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Outside solar developer with no local ties; minimal community presence beyond the proposed project

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct engagement with the project’s representative (e.g. New Leaf Energy’s Tom Ryan) to discuss a mutually beneficial arrangement or buyout; emphasize collaboration over conflict since their project already faces community and regulatory hurdles

neighbors.name: Pearson Ronald W & L Rita Trustees
neighbors.influence_justification: Trustees for an individual landowner; standing in community depends on personal reputation (not publicly documented)

neighbors.name: Old National Bank - Trustee
neighbors.claims: Old National Bank is listed as trustee for an Illinois land trust holding these parcels; the trust’s beneficiary (actual owner) is not identified in public records [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust). The beneficial owner remains unknown, consistent with Illinois land trust practices that keep landowner identities confidential [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust).
neighbors.influence_justification: Beneficial owner not publicly known; unable to gauge community influence without knowing who controls the trust

approach_recommendations.engage: Attempt to ascertain the trust’s beneficiary through discreet inquiries or public filings; engage the actual landowner (once identified) directly, since the bank trustee will not make substantive decisions

neighbors.name: Chicago Title Land Trust Co
neighbors.claims: Chicago Title Land Trust Company holds title to this parcel as trustee of a land trust; the identity of the beneficiary (true owner) is not disclosed under Illinois land trust law [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust). The actual landowner directing the trust remains confidential, so the beneficial ownership and intentions are unknown [Wikipedia – Land Trust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_trust).
neighbors.influence_justification: Underlying owner is undisclosed; community standing cannot be determined without knowing who the beneficiary is

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the trust’s beneficiary via local connections or records and reach out to that person/family directly; the trustee company itself will only act per the beneficiary’s instructions

neighbors.name: Sipal Family Ltd Partnership
neighbors.claims: Sipal Family Ltd Partnership is a private Illinois family partnership that owns multiple agriculturally zoned land parcels in the Rochelle area [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/). The partnership appears to serve solely as a vehicle for holding the Sipal family’s farmland, with no other active business operations noted in public records [Shaw Local (Oct 23, 2025)](https://www.shawlocal.com/ogle-county-news/2025/10/23/ogle-county-board-denies-one-solar-permit-approves-another/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local landowners with substantial acreage; well-established in the farming community but without public political roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Sipal family privately (through a local peer or advisor) and acknowledge their agricultural heritage; offer incentives (e.g. improved land management or tax benefits) that align the development with their financial and land-use interests
